title: Black Holes, Warp Drives, and Energy Conditions
abstract:
Following the work of H. Ellis, we study warp drives in the gravitational
field of a Schwarzschild black hole. We find that as long as the warp drive
crosses the black hole horizon at a subluminal speed, the horizon would be
effectively absent inside the warp bubble. Moreover, we discover that the black
hole's gravitational field can alleviate the violations of the weak energy
condition (WEC) and the null energy condition (NEC) and therefore decrease the
amount of negative energy required to sustain a warp drive, which may be
instrumental for creating microscopic warp drives in lab experiments. We also
consider the thermodynamics of a warp bubble interacting with a black hole and
point out some paradoxes that may indicate a gap in our understanding of them
from the thermodynamic point of view.
